title: Max Baucus
summary: Maxwell Sieben Baucus (n√© Enke; born December 11, 1941) is an American politician who served as a United States Senator from Montana from 1978 to 2014. A  member of the Democratic Party, he was a U.S. Senator for over 35 years, making him the longest-serving Senator in Montana history. President Barack Obama appointed Baucus to replace Gary Locke as the 11th U.S. Ambassador to the People's Republic of China, a position he held from 2014 until 2017.[1][2]
